content.question: ​The rational function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals fraction numerator n open parentheses x close parentheses over denominator d open parentheses x close parentheses end fraction"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>n</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfrac></math>, where <math alttext="n"><mi>n</mi></math> and <math alttext="d"><mi>d</mi></math> are polynomial functions. The degree of <math alttext="n"><mi>n</mi></math> is less than the degree of <math alttext="d"><mi>d</mi></math>. Which of the following could be the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> ?

choices.label:
The x axis ranges from negative 7 to 7 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 3 to 9 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right: 

The curve enters the window at (negative 7.5 comma negative 1.5). 

The curve increases steadily to reach the x axis at (negative 1.5 comma 0).

The curve decreases to cross the y axis at (0 comma negative 0.5) and continues to decrease and exit the window at (1.2 comma negative 3.1). 

A second section of the curve enters the window at (2.5 comma 9.5) and decreases sharply. 

The curve passes through (3 comma 6), reaches a low point at (5.5 comma 4.5), and then increases steadily to exit the window at (7.5 comma 5).

The x axis ranges from negative 7 to 7 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 3 to 9 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right:

The curve enters the window at (negative 7.5 comma 4). 

The curve decreases gradually to cross the x axis at (negative 2 comma 0). 

The curve reaches a low point at (negative 1 comma negative 0.2). 

The curve increases to pass through the origin and reach a high point at (0.5 comma 0.1).

The curve decreases to cross the x axis at (1 comma 0) and then decreases sharply to exit the window at (1.9 comma negative 3.2). 

A second section of the curve enters the window at (2.1 comma 9.2). 

The curve decreases sharply to reach a low point at (2.9 comma 3). 

The curve gradually increases to exit the window at (7.5 comma 8.5).

The x axis ranges from negative 7 to 7 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 3 to 9 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right: 

The curve enters the window at (negative 7.5 comma 1.9). 

The curve decreases to cross the x axis at (negative 2 comma 0). 

The curve continues to decrease to exit the window at (negative 1.2 comma negative 3.2). 

A second section of the curve enters the window at (negative 0.9 comma 9.2).

The curve decreases sharply to cross the y axis at (0 comma 2).

The curve continues to cross the x axis at (1 comma 0) and exit the window at (1.8 comma negative 3.2).

A third section of the curve enters the window at (2.1 comma 9.2).

The curve decreases sharply to (3 comma 5) and then transitions to a more shallow decrease to exit the window at (7.5 comma 2.5).

The x axis ranges from negative 7 to 7 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 3 to 9 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right: 

The curve enters the window at (negative 7.5 comma negative 0.1). 

The curve nearly follows the x axis until reaching the point (negative 1.5 comma negative 0.1) and then decreases sharply to exit the window at (negative 1.1 comma negative 3.2). 

A second section of the curve enters the window at (negative 0.9 comma 9.2). 

The curve decreases sharply to reach a low point at (negative 0.6 comma 2.1), at which it sharply increases and exits the window at (negative 0.1 comma 9.2). 

A third section of the curve enters the window at (0.2 comma negative 3.2) and increases to reach a high point at (1 comma negative 1.5).

The curve decreases to exit the window at (1.9 comma negative 3.2). 

A fourth section of the curve enters the window at (2.1 comma 9.2) and decreases sharply to the point (2.5 comma 1). 

The curve then decreases to nearly follow the x axis and exit the window at (7.5 comma 0.1).

content.answer:
The x axis ranges from negative 7 to 7 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 3 to 9 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right: 

The curve enters the window at (negative 7.5 comma negative 0.1). 

The curve nearly follows the x axis until reaching the point (negative 1.5 comma negative 0.1) and then decreases sharply to exit the window at (negative 1.1 comma negative 3.2). 

A second section of the curve enters the window at (negative 0.9 comma 9.2). 

The curve decreases sharply to reach a low point at (negative 0.6 comma 2.1), at which it sharply increases and exits the window at (negative 0.1 comma 9.2). 

A third section of the curve enters the window at (0.2 comma negative 3.2) and increases to reach a high point at (1 comma negative 1.5).

The curve decreases to exit the window at (1.9 comma negative 3.2). 

A fourth section of the curve enters the window at (2.1 comma 9.2) and decreases sharply to the point (2.5 comma 1). 

The curve then decreases to nearly follow the x axis and exit the window at (7.5 comma 0.1).

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
